strings.Value: "The shaman was mumbling about a 'season of Bloom.' It seems the seeds the people swallowed turned into portals."
"No time to deal with that now. We must rescue the survivors."
"I'm glad you're safe, Kesten."
"The shaman mentioned a place up the stream, 'Lamashtu's Womb.' It is the source of the seeds."
"Lamashtu's Womb... This place must be crawling with monsters. You think you can do it?"
"What will become of the survivors in this camp?"

"Kesten, you are in my service, not to play hero-in-the-woods while my subjects — the families of your militia — are being sacrificed. Now fulfil your duty — gather your squad and take it to the capital!"
"Do you think Kavken can hold out until my arrival?"
"Go to Lamashtu's Womb, Kesten. I'll make a decision and head out later."
"Why don't you go to the capital?"
{n}Kesten breathes heavily, looking around the bloody battlefield.{/n} "Your Grace... how can this be? The people... the prisoners from the camp... they've... exploded! Just like that!"

{n}Kesten wipes his brow.{/n} "If all the seeds have blossomed... {g|Abadar}Abadar{/g} protect us, the capital is full of infected! Both on the streets and in Kavken's hospital!" {n}Kesten turns to you.{/n} "You must hurry to the capital — I will continue looking for the source of the seeds."
"Then I'm gathering my men and heading out there." {n}Kesten brow darkens, and his eyes narrow.{/n} "I swear upon my life I will find this Womb, Your Grace, and destroy the source of the disease!"

"But Kavken... gods be merciful, he has no one to protect him! And the citizens... Will the guard be enough to halt the attack of these horrid creatures?" {n}Kesten falls silent for a moment, his brow troubled.{/n} "No, I have to go up the river, make sure there are no new seeds — I must stop this curse at the source!"
{n}Kesten freezes, his face becoming a mask.{/n} "I don't know, {mf|baron|baroness}. I cannot promise anything." {n}He gives a wry grin.{/n} "But we do not seem to have a choice."
"Most who survived the opening of the Bloom ran. I hope they find their way home — or manage to reach the main road and are found by the patrols."

{n}Kesten freezes, then lowers his eyes.{/n} "I am sorry, Your Grace. The immediacy of the situation clouded my judgment." {n}He steps back and bows.{/n} "I shall head to the capital at once, {mf|baron|baroness}."

"If you leave for the capital now, yes. But if you head to {g|Lamashtu}Lamashtu's{/g} Womb..." {n}Kesten frowns.{/n} "Jhod is not a warrior, Your Grace. He is a priest. He will shield his wards to the last — but he will likely have gone to join his god if we do not reach him in time."

{n}Kesten nods.{/n} "Do not linger, {mf|baron|baroness}. If you go to the Womb, you will certainly catch up with my soldiers. If you go to the capital, I hope you'll arrive in time to help the people there. {g|Abadar}Abadar{/g} protect you!"

"It is for you to decide, Your Grace, where your help is more needed. Jhod will defend his patients to his last. As for me..." {n}Kesten frowns. {/n} "I'll do the same — anything to put an end to this horror, once and for all."
"No, Your Grace. I must find the source of the seeds, no matter the cost. This is my decision."{n} Kesten's face is stone.{/n} "And the last word on the matter."
"What's wrong with you, Captain? You're going against orders! I wouldn't have taken you for one of those careless adventurers, who think the chain of command exists only for the sake of appearances!"
"I'm sorry if I have disappointed you, Lady Kaessi. But I will not turn back. Not now, when we must do everything we can to put an end to this calamity."
"You have a noble soul, Kesten. Those who are ready to protect the helpless, no matter to cost – they are the backbone of this world. May the gods keep you safe!"
